Previous Next
Lucknow, is the capital of the state of Uttar Pradesh. "This bustling city, famed for its Nawabi era finesse and amazing food, is a unique mix of the ancient and the modern.
It also home to extraordinary monuments depicting a fascinating blend of ancient, colonial and oriental architecture.

How to Reach

Air

Lucknow’s Chaudhary Charan Singh Airport (15 km from Hazratganj) is directly connected by regular flights with Delhi, Patna, Kolkata, Mumbai, Varanasi, Hyderabad and Sharjah, Muscat, Jeddah, Dubai.

Rail

Lucknow is linked with prominent cities by Northern Railway and North Eastern Railway. Major railway stations are Charbagh, Lucknow Junction, Lucknow City Junction, Aishbagh, Badshahnagar, Daliganj, Amausi and Mahibullapur and Malhaur.
Historical Monuments and Architectures
Bara Imambara

This large structure was built by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula in 1786-91 and is one of the architectural wonders of that era.

Read more
Jama Masjid

The construction of Jama Masjid was started in 1837 during the reign of Muhammad Ali Shah but was completed after his death by his begum, Nawab Malika Janah.

Read more
Clock Tower

Near Rumi Darwaza, this 221 ft. high Clock Tower was built in 1881 to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, the first Lieutenant Governor of the United Province of Awadh.

Read more
Residency

The main building overlooks the river Gomti and is surrounded by terraced lawns and gardens. Today, only the scarred ruins bear witness to the turmoil of 1857.

Read more
Lucknow's Uniqueness

Kathak

Kathak ( कथक ) is one of the eight major forms of Indian classical dance.The term Kathak is derived from the Vedic Sanskrit word Katha which means "story", and Kathaka which means "the one who tells a story", or "to do with stories". Kathak dancers tell various stories through their hand movements, footwork adorned with small bells (Ghungroo) but most importantly through their facial expressions.

Chinkankari Dresses

Chinkankari is most traditional embroidery styles introduced from Lucknow is believed to be introduced by Nur Jehan, Mughal Emperor Jahangir's wife.Lucknow is the exclusive hub for Chikankari work and has received Geographical Indication for Chikankari in December 2008.It is usually done by white yarn by making flowers on all types of cloth.
Explore about Food, Shopping and Parks

Crazy about food .... Find food you must try.

Sheermal

Sheermal or Shirmal, is a saffron-flavored traditional flatbread made in Greater Iran and Indian subcontinent, probably from Persian influences. It is one of the several rare Lucknow and Hyderabadi delicacies in India.

Kebab

Kebabs are various cooked meat dishes, with their origins in Middive Eastern cuisine. Many variants are popular throughout Asia, and around the world.

Shopping Place to visit

Hazratganj

The most famous Chikan shop known as Ada is located here. Apart from Ada, you would get a branch of another most popular Lucknow Chikan shop called ‘Seva Chikan’ too. If you are fond of junk jewelry, pure khadi, Hazartganj is the place to go.

Aminabad

This bazaar in Lucknow dates back to the era of Nawabs.The place is famous largely for books, chikan and the most famous food joints like Prakash Kulfi, Netram Kachori and Tunday Kebabi too.The major attraction of Aminabad is ‘Gadbadjhala’. This is one of the biggest bangles and matching center.

Parks to Visit around #Lucknow

Ambedkar Memorial Park

Ambedkar Memorial Park is a public park and memorial in Gomti Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India. It is more formally known as Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Samajik Parivartan Prateek Sthal and is also referred to simply as "Ambedkar Park".

Janeshwar Mishra Park

Janeshwar Mishra Park is an urban park operating in Gomti Nagar in Lucknow, India. It was made in memory of late politician Janeshwar Mishra from Samajwadi Party. The park was inaugurated for general public of the city on 5 August 2014.
